reviews.review_msg: His sense of humour is relentless and exhausting. I found that it was difficult to understand what he wanted in assignments, given that much of the course material was very abstract. Also a fairly tough marker, made worse by the fact that most of his comments were only the word "good" or "yes" regardless of whether you got an A or a C.

The class was okay... He tries too hard to be funny, and inspirational. He gets very behind in marking reading responses. Doesn't give good feedback, not very concise. Long lectures, and LONG group discussions. Made the last paper due on the same day as the final exam. He does seem like he cares about his students though.
